section.title: jManage Overview
section.p:
jManage is a web and command-line based JMX client, which provides a centralized console for managing application clusters and distributed application production environments.
We are currently developing version 0.5, which has the following features:
- Web based interface, which allows jManage to be used from behind firewall
- Complete security - application server passwords are encrypted
- Command line interface
- Support for different J2EE app servers
- Authentication and Role Management
- Configuring Applications in jManage
- Runtime Graphing
jManage is being built keeping security in mind, as the main target usage of jManage is in the production environment. Production environments usually have limited access and are managed by an operations team. jManage lets the operations team to monitor the production environment (via browser or command line) and also allows the operations team to give controlled access to developers, QA and others. Operations team can create jManage users and assign roles to these users. Access to different features can be controlled by assigining permissions to various roles. Permission can be granted even at the level of MBean attributes or operations.
